meta.description: Drug comparison data for MedRep AI. Each table compares drugs within a therapeutic category with evidence-based differentiators.
meta.source: Clinical literature, PubMed/PMC citations, trial data (URANUS, ONTARGET, UKPDS, COGENT, GINA 2024, etc.)

comparisons.title: Statins: Atorvastatin vs Rosuvastatin

parameters.preference: Rosuvastatin more potent; 5mg rosuvastatin ≈ 10mg atorvastatin

parameters.atorvastatin: Strong CYP3A4 substrate (grapefruit, macrolides, HIV protease inhibitors)
parameters.preference: Rosuvastatin preferred in patients on multiple medications

parameters.atorvastatin: 14 hours (long-acting — any time of day is acceptable)
parameters.preference: Both are long-acting: take at any consistent time. 'Night-only' advice applies only to short-acting statins.
Atorvastatin for cost-conscious; Rosuvastatin for potency needs

parameters.atorvastatin: First-line for most patients; cost-effective option
parameters.rosuvastatin: Higher LDL targets; significant polypharmacy with CYP3A4 inhibitors; partial statin intolerance (hydrophilic)
parameters.preference: Both acceptable in diabetes — choose by LDL target, cost, interactions. Do NOT default to rosuvastatin for all diabetics.

comparisons.key_takeaway: Rosuvastatin is more potent per mg and has fewer CYP3A4 interactions; atorvastatin is often cheaper. Use either based on LDL target, comorbidities and cost — guidelines do not mandate one over the other.

comparisons.title: ARBs: Losartan vs Telmisartan

parameters.preference: Telmisartan: true 24-hr coverage; Losartan may need twice daily
Telmisartan: more sustained BP control

parameters.losartan: Requires CYP2C9 conversion to active metabolite E-3174
parameters.telmisartan: Active as parent drug (minimal CYP450 metabolism, mainly biliary excretion)
parameters.preference: Telmisartan: more predictable response; simpler in polypharmacy

parameters.losartan: Uricosuric (lowers uric acid) — good for gout
parameters.telmisartan: Neutral on uric acid; improves insulin sensitivity
parameters.preference: Losartan: gout patients; Telmisartan: diabetes patients

parameters.telmisartan: Resistant HTN; diabetes; consistent 24-hr control; missed-dose concerns

comparisons.key_takeaway: Both are guideline-accepted first-line ARBs. Telmisartan has longer action and fewer CYP interactions; Losartan has unique uricosuric benefit for gout. Select by comorbidities, not blanket preference.

comparisons.title: Antihypertensives: Amlodipine (CCB) vs ARBs (Losartan/Telmisartan)

parameters.preference: ARBs: better tolerability; Amlodipine: effective but edema common
ARBs preferred in CKD with proteinuria

parameters.arb: Improved insulin sensitivity; may reduce new-onset diabetes
parameters.preference: ARB preferred in metabolic syndrome/diabetes

parameters.amlodipine: Elderly, isolated systolic HTN, low-renin states; cost-effective monotherapy
parameters.arb: Diabetes, CKD, proteinuria, heart failure, metabolic syndrome

comparisons.key_takeaway: Both are first-line. Amlodipine for elderly/ISH; ARBs for diabetes/CKD. Often combined as Amlodipine+Telmisartan FDC.

comparisons.title: Antiplatelets: Aspirin vs Clopidogrel vs DAPT

parameters.dapt: Post-PCI: 6-12 months; ACS: 12 months; Minor stroke/TIA: 21-90 days

parameters.preference: Avoid ibuprofen with aspirin; avoid omeprazole with clopidogrel

parameters.clopidogrel: Aspirin allergy; post-PCI; peripheral artery disease

comparisons.key_takeaway: DAPT is standard after PCI (duration tailored to ischaemic vs bleeding risk). Clopidogrel is the primary alternative to aspirin. For GI protection with clopidogrel, avoid omeprazole/esomeprazole and prefer pantoprazole or a similar low-interaction PPI.

comparisons.title: PPIs: Pantoprazole vs Omeprazole vs Rabeprazole

parameters.preference: Pantoprazole or Rabeprazole for patients on Clopidogrel

parameters.pantoprazole: Patients on Clopidogrel/DAPT; cardiac patients; GERD/PUD
parameters.rabeprazole: Alternative to pantoprazole; rapid acid control needed

evidence: Cardiology guidance: Avoid omeprazole/esomeprazole with clopidogrel; use pantoprazole or other low-CYP2C19-inhibiting PPI
comparisons.key_takeaway: Avoid omeprazole/esomeprazole with clopidogrel when alternatives exist; prefer pantoprazole or another weak CYP2C19 inhibitor (e.g., rabeprazole) for GI protection.

comparisons.title: Antibiotics: Amoxicillin vs Amox+Clav vs Azithromycin vs Cefixime

parameters.cefixime: Less favoured — rising resistance in Indian enteric fever
parameters.preference: In Indian enteric fever: azithromycin or ceftriaxone IV preferred; cefixime monotherapy less favoured due to resistance
Azithromycin: best compliance

parameters.amoxicillin: Simple infections in low-resistance settings; first-line URTI
parameters.amox_clav: Suspected β-lactamase organisms; sinusitis; bite wounds
parameters.azithromycin: Atypical infections; typhoid; non-compliance; penicillin allergy
parameters.cefixime: Typhoid alternative; amoxicillin allergy; uncomplicated UTI

comparisons.key_takeaway: India-specific: Azithromycin or ceftriaxone preferred for typhoid (cefixime less favoured due to resistance). Reserve amox-clav and azithro for clear indications — antimicrobial stewardship matters.

comparisons.title: NSAIDs: Paracetamol vs Ibuprofen vs Diclofenac vs Aceclofenac

parameters.paracetamol: Lowest GI risk; main limitation is hepatotoxicity in overdose or chronic high doses
parameters.aceclofenac: Moderate-High (metabolised to diclofenac — probably carries similar CV risk)

parameters.paracetamol: Lowest relative CV risk; main limitation is hepatic toxicity at high or chronic doses
parameters.preference: Paracetamol safest for cardiac patients (watch liver)
AVOID Ibuprofen in patients on low-dose Aspirin

parameters.paracetamol: First-line for mild pain/fever; patients on aspirin; elderly; renal impairment; preferred analgesic throughout pregnancy
parameters.ibuprofen: Short-term MSK pain/fever in low CV/GI risk adults; avoid in 3rd trimester pregnancy
parameters.diclofenac: Severe inflammatory pain (arthritis); topical preferred over oral; avoid in 3rd trimester
parameters.aceclofenac: Chronic arthritis; GI profile may be somewhat better than diclofenac but CV/renal risks remain; avoid in 3rd trimester
parameters.preference: PREGNANCY: Paracetamol preferred throughout. ALL NSAIDs (ibuprofen/diclofenac/aceclofenac) contraindicated in 3rd trimester (ductus arteriosus, renal risks).

comparisons.key_takeaway: Paracetamol is safest first-line (watch liver). NEVER combine Ibuprofen with Aspirin. Diclofenac has highest CV risk. ALL NSAIDs avoid in 3rd trimester pregnancy.

comparisons.title: Diabetes: Metformin vs Glimepiride

parameters.metformin: YES — ADA/EASD/API standard first-line for most T2DM
parameters.preference: Metformin is standard first-line; add or consider SGLT2i/GLP-1 RA early in patients with ASCVD/HF/CKD when accessible
Metformin safer in elderly, patients living alone
Metformin preferred for overweight/obese

parameters.metformin: Yes (UKPDS legacy effect); acceptable in stable HF with adequate renal function
parameters.glimepiride: Neutral; hypoglycaemia itself may worsen outcomes
parameters.preference: Metformin preferred in CAD/stable HF. For high ASCVD/HF/CKD risk: SGLT2i or GLP-1 RA now preferred early (when available/affordable).

parameters.metformin: All T2DM unless contraindicated; prediabetes; metabolic syndrome
parameters.glimepiride: Metformin intolerance; need rapid glucose reduction; combination therapy

comparisons.key_takeaway: Metformin is universal first-line. Add Glimepiride when A1c targets not met and cost limits SGLT2i/GLP-1 RA access. Caution: Glimepiride causes hypoglycemia and weight gain.

comparisons.title: Respiratory: Salbutamol vs Budesonide vs Montelukast+Levocetirizine

parameters.montelukast_levo: Moderate (hours for levocetirizine; days for montelukast)
parameters.preference: SABA: rescue; Others: maintenance

parameters.budesonide: Oral candidiasis, hoarseness, adrenal suppression (high dose)
parameters.montelukast_levo: Montelukast: neuropsychiatric effects (FDA black box); Levocetirizine: mild sedation
parameters.preference: ICS: lowest effective dose; Montelukast: monitor mood changes

parameters.salbutamol: Acute symptom relief and pre-exercise prophylaxis — ONLY within an ICS-based strategy (SABA-only regimens discouraged by GINA 2024)
parameters.budesonide: Any persistent asthma or high-risk intermittent asthma requiring exacerbation prevention; core ICS in MART/SMART regimens
parameters.montelukast_levo: Co-existing allergic rhinitis; exercise-induced or aspirin-sensitive asthma; as add-on to ICS±LABA. Note: montelukast has neuropsychiatric warnings (FDA)

comparisons.key_takeaway: GINA 2024: SABA-only treatment DISCOURAGED due to increased exacerbation risk. All adults/adolescents should receive ICS-containing therapy (daily ICS or as-needed ICS-formoterol). Montelukast is add-on, not ICS replacement, and carries neuropsychiatric warnings.
comparisons.critical_warning: If patient uses Salbutamol >3 times/week, asthma is poorly controlled — step up ICS therapy.
